intro: Epilobium luteum f. brevifolium, commonly known as the yellow willow herb, is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its short, broad leaves and showy yellow flowers. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Its compact growth habit and distinctive floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
